channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: The price of Bitcoin drops below $65,000
item.description: On Thursday, Bitcoin's value fell over 10 percent in a single day, dropping to around $64,000, the lowest it has been since the 2024 Presidential election, as CNBC reports. After crossing $100,000 in November 2024 and peaking at over $122,000 in October 2025, the cryptocurrency has been in a steady decline for the last several […]

item.title: No, Jeffrey Epstein Is Probably Not Satoshi Nakamoto
item.description: There are lots of revelations about Epstein's relationship with the crypto world in the files. That's not one of them.

item.title: Is that a mini PC or a NES? Acemagic Retro X3 features some familiar casing, but with a welcome hardware boost inside
item.description: Acemagic’s Retro X3 mini PC blends nostalgic beige design with modern Ryzen performance, modular upgrades, and versatile connectivity options.

item.title: ICE and CBP’s Face-Recognition App Can’t Actually Verify Who People Are
item.description: ICE has used Mobile Fortify to identify immigrants and citizens alike over 100,000 times, by one estimate. It wasn't built to work like that—and only got approved after DHS abandoned its own privacy rules.

item.title: OpenAI Enters a New Frontier: Trying to Make Money
item.description: They're hoping companies will pay for AI agent management.

item.title: Everything we know about Valve's new Steam Machine
item.description: The Steam Machine is back from the dead. Not as a Valve-supported program for manufacturers to create living room PCs, but instead a home console sibling to the Steam Deck. Valve introduced its second attempt at ruling the living room in a surprise hardware announcement in November 2025, and paired the new Steam Machine with a new Steam Controller and a wireless VR headset it calls the Steam Frame. Since the announcement, as is often the case with Valve, some details remain elusive, however.While we wait for the release of the company's new hardware lineup in 2026, and more information straigh...

item.title: OpenAI launches new agentic coding model only minutes after Anthropic drops its own
item.description: The new model is build to accelerate the capabilities of Codex, the agentic coding tool OpenAI launched earlier this week.

item.title: ‘Rock Springs’ Brings Horror From the Past Into Its Tale of Contemporary Grief
item.description: Writer-director Vera Miao’s film, which stars Kelly Marie Tran and Benedict Wong, premiered in the Midnight program at the 2026 Sundance Film Festival.

item.title: On a bien détecté le code-barres cosmique des trous noirs !
item.description: Comment être certain que des objets aussi exotiques que des trous noirs existent bel et bien dans le cosmos observable ? Les astrophysiciens relativistes ont la solution depuis presque un demi-siècle, mais il a fallu attendre l'essor puis le développement de l'astrophysique des ondes...

item.title: Prime members can play Alan Wake 2 for free on Luna
item.description: If you haven't yet played Alan Wake 2, here's your chance to immerse yourself in its terrors for free. Prime members can play it this month on Amazon's Luna cloud gaming service at no additional charge.The "fantastic" Alan Wake 2 oozes "psychedelic terror," as Engadget's Jessica Conditt put it in our review. The 2023 horror-survival game uses a dual-protagonist motif, alternating between the lost author Wake and the stoic FBI agent Saga Anderson. It "tells a twisted, serpentine story of paranormal murder, shifting realities and demonic possession, with two brooding investigators at its core." ...

item.title: Meta is giving its AI slop feed an app of its own
item.description: Meta is developing a standalone app for Vibes, its feed of AI-generated videos, according to reports from TechCrunch and Platformer. Vibes was introduced as a feature in the Meta AI app in September 2025. Similar to OpenAI's Sora app, Vibes lets users prompt Meta AI to create TikTok-style vertical videos."Following the strong early traction of Vibes within Meta AI, we are testing a standalone app to build on that momentum," Meta said in a statement. "We’ve seen that users are increasingly leaning into the format to create, discover, and share AI-generated video with friends. This standalone ap...

item.title: The Nintendo Switch 2 proved me wrong in several ways, and it's why I'd suggest buying it now before price hikes
item.description: I've been surprised by the Nintendo Switch 2 after trying it, and since it could see a price hike soon, now's the best time to make a move for it.

item.title: Project Hail Mary is getting its own LEGO set
item.description: The upcoming science fiction film Project Hail Mary is getting a LEGO set. This is fascinating because LEGO typically makes sets based on long-standing franchises like Star Wars and Harry Potter. Project Hail Mary doesn't even hit theaters until March 20. It's not an entirely new IP. The movie is based on a 2021 book written by Andy Weir, the same author behind The Martian. It's cool to see a LEGO set based on something more contemporary than its usual fare. The 830-piece set looks pretty nifty. It includes a replica of The Hail Mary spaceship in all of its glory, complete with minifigures of...

item.title: Zuckerberg considered changing how Meta studies social issues after research got it in trouble
item.description: One day after The Wall Street Journal published a blockbuster story about Meta's own dismal findings about teen girls' mental health on Instagram, CEO Mark Zuckerberg wondered whether Meta should change how it studies its platforms' potential harms. "Recent events have made me consider whether we should change our approach to research and analytics around […]...

item.title: Xikipedia Wants to Take the ‘Doom’ Out of ‘Doomscrolling’
item.description: An endless feed of random Wikipedia articles might be just what your soul needs.

item.title: Laurence Fishburne Is the Latest Big Name to Join Mike Flanagan’s ‘The Exorcist’
item.description: The 'Matrix' legend has joined the star-studded cast for Flanagan's all-new take on the horror classic.

item.title: 9 Great Deals on WIRED-Approved Valentine's Day Gifts (2026)
item.description: These swoon-worthy deals on WIRED-tested date night boxes, sex toys, and other gadgets will make your Valentine's Day extra sweet.

item.title: One of Europe’s largest universities knocked offline for days after cyberattack
item.description: An alleged ransomware attack has taken down the systems of the Sapienza University of Rome.

item.title: Can You Guess What Creature Won the Close-Up Photographer of the Year Competition?
item.description: We'll give you a hint: It lives underwater, but it doesn't swim. At least, not as an adult.

item.title: This 'feature-stuffed pocket rocket' of a Garmin watch is at its lowest price ever – perfect timing for warmer spring runs
item.description: If you're a seasonal runner, the Garmin Vivoactive 6 is just what you need.

item.title: Elon Musk is getting serious about orbital data centers
item.description: We’re starting to see the idea of Musk-owned orbital AI data clusters cohere into an actual plan.

item.title: La PlayStation 5 devrait échapper à une nouvelle augmentation de prix
item.description: Enfin une bonne nouvelle concernant la pénurie de mémoire vive et de stockage. Sony aurait suffisamment fait de stocks pour éviter d'augmenter le prix de la PS5.

item.title: The CIA stops publishing The World Factbook
item.description: The US Central Intelligence Agency is ending one of its popular services, The World Factbook. Over the decades, this reference has provided readers with information about different countries and communities around the world. The post from the CIA announcing the news didn't provide any information about why it will stop offering The World Factbook. The agency was subject to the same buyouts and job cuts that decimated much of the federal workforce in 2025, so maybe this type of public-facing tool is no longer a priority. This reference guide was first published in 1962 as The National Basic Int...

item.title: How data centers provided power during Winter Storm Fern
item.description: Before Wright’s order, it was hard to say whether data centers would reduce the amount of electricity they take from the grid during storms or other emergencies. As Winter Storm Fern swept across the United States in late January 2026, bringing ice, snow, and freezing temperatures, it left more than a million people without power, mostly in the Southeast....

item.title: The 2026 Winter Olympics Will Have a Major Impact on the Region’s Snow
item.description: A recent report found that carbon emissions caused by the Milano Cortina Olympics could lead to the loss of 5.5 square kilometers of snowpack and millions of metric tons of glacial ice.
